Orthogonality

  //   Topics: Linear Algebra

Orthogonality is a generalized version of the concept of two things being perpendicular; for example, two lines in a 2D plane at right angles to one another are said to be orthogonal.

Vectors

Two vectors are said to be orthogonal if their dot product equals \(\pmb {0}\).
